div.p: REFUGEES a term at firſt applied to the French Proteſtants, who, by the revocation of the edict of Nantz, were conſtrained to fly from perſeeution, and take refuge in foreign countries. Since that time, however, it has been extended to all ſuch as leave their country in times of diſtreſs ; and hence, ſince the revolt of the Britiſii colonies in America, we have frequently heard of American refugees.
